intro: Zollikoferia elquiensis, commonly known as the Elqui false flax, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coastline, where it thrives in the temperate and arid climate. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. Zollikoferia elquiensis is adapted to withstand coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
